author: IndyLibrarian
title: High playability and some nice vehicles
review:
I found this Police K9 unit to be a big improvement over the previous model 7285. This set features a small building, a nice hot rod truck for the crooks, and a solid police SUV for the officer and his dogs.

Box/Instructions

Instructions come in three parts - the hideout, the red truck, and the police SUV.

Minifigures

Two criminals - one a suave jewel thief and the other I take to be hired muscle. The police officer has two dogs so you can really build up your German Shepard army.

The build

I like the use of the brown chair pieces for the truck bed. The periscope in the hideout is a nice addition too. The police SUV is more solid than its predecessor, and more realistic looking too.

Overall opinion

An extra dog for your collection, plus a nicely designed police vehicle and an interesting civilian vehicle. Lots of playability.

author: koen_theys
title: Throw those Crooks a bone
review:
I got this set for my daughter. In my opinion a very good looking small set with a lot of playability. Much nicer looking that the 7285 - Police Dog Unit of 2011.

Box/Instructions

Normal LEGO City Box. On the backside there are several images of playability. 

There are 3 booklets, one for the Crooks Hot Rod, one for the Crooks Hide Out and the third for the Police K-9 Dog Truck. The instructions are very simple and the building progress is very basic, about 3 pieces per built. Ideal for young builders.

Minifigures

- 2 Crooks

- 1 Police officer

- 2 K-9 dogs

- 1 mouse

Several minifig tools such as a crowbar, money, a diamond, dog bones, cheese, golden cup and handcuffs. 

The build

As I said before, very simple building progress with about 2 to 3 pieces per built. For elder children the built is very simple but for new builders an ideal start.

The completed model

The Hot Rod

A very nice looking hot rod. The double wheel base at the back is fun and gives the truck something special. Looking to it from a rabbit's caught in the headlights view, the hot rod is just super badass. However, there are no headlights so the rabbit can hop away. It's a hot rod so it doesn't need any headlights.

The back loader is made of 4 brown chairs, a good find of the creator. After the build I can only spot one drawback and that is that the front axle is black, and the back axle is cream yellow. I would prefer white as older cars have often white wheel hubs.

The Crooks hideout

Nice looking hideout with a periscope. Perhaps just a little to small. It would have been better is it was 2 studs wider and longer. The small side doors to the supposed basement are rather small.

The K-9 Police Truck

One word: it's huge! Just as the hot rod, the truck is badass with a nice color scheme. An instant classic for me, however the back of the truck could have been better.

I think i'm going to add a 1x1 holder piece to the roof dog unite of the Police Truck so the flashlight of the officer can be put away.

Overall opinion

Superb set with a lot of playability. Love it!
